      • allow

        public boolean allow(R target,
            boolean throw_reason)
              throws LifeCycleException
        Description copied from interface: ActionListener
        Does the ActionListener want to allow the event to take place. This is to give the listener a chance to veto the event when it knows in advance its not capable of supporting the operation in its current state. For example veto project setup because there are no machines configured.
        Specified by:
        allow in interface ActionListener<R>
        Throws:
        LifeCycleException
        Parameters:
        target - object.
        throw_reason - set to true to throw exception instead of returning boolean.
        Returns:
        boolean true if operation allowed

      • action

        public void action(R target)
        Description copied from interface: ActionListener
        Called after the event has taken place (and any external actions have completed) to allow the LifeCycleListener to make/finalise corresponding changes to its own objects.
        Specified by:
        action in interface ActionListener<R>

      • getTarget

        public final java.lang.Class<? super R> getTarget()
        Description copied from interface: Targetted
        Get the type of the returned object as far as it is known. This method is used for run-time type checking The result objects will always be assignable to the type returned by this method.
        Specified by:
        getTarget in interface Targetted<R>
        Returns:
        Class object for return type
